intro: Lettsomia maingayi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Lettsomia maingayi is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
